description:
You are the one they will tell you about

"His last party was like a Predator meeting with Sauron."

Discover the story of the Promila Ruler.

The time has come to go to the Bottom of the Mortuary, to give the Big Eye the Evil Cookie and take it to the Oven of Destiny - where it will be burned, incinerated, stoned, smoked and thus stop the Big Eye, which wants to cover the world with eternal darkness (yes, it has photophobia). Then there will be great joy ... and every joy should be poured out. In this evil plan, you will be disturbed by the cookie guardian - Bloodthirsty York. But don't worry ... if you fail to deliver the Cake to Piecyek, it may be eternal darkness, but you can always pour your sorrows out of despair.

Simple rules are a way to quickly engage your friends.
The rivalry, twists and turns of the Bloodthirsty York guarantee that you will be happy to come back to the game at subsequent events.
Powerful references to "a certain trilogy" will provide you with an additional, abstract dose of humor.
Everything in addition twice - two boards, two types of gameplay, it's twice as crazy party!

The Enclave is an asymmetrical board game of strategy in the conflict between several fantasy factions. This armed conflict is centered around the Human kingdom, which is divided by four opposing sides: The Horde, Iron fist, Forest union and Cult. Each player takes on the role of one of the four sides.

During the game, players develop unique technologies of their faction, conduct research, claim or destroy different objectives on the playing board. They gather armies, build structures and attract neutral units to join their cause. To achieve victory, players must complete military and diplomatic missions, while also pursuing their factions’ unique secret agendas.

Warfighter is a card game for 1 to 6 players. You can play solo or cooperatively with your friends against the system to complete World War II squad-level combat missions, set in the Mediterranean Theatre of Operations (MTO) in Italy.

The core game gives you a full team of Italian Soldiers and a full set of British Hostiles. Each Expansion then adds to these sets.

This includes the soldiers, weapons, equipment, and tactics used by each of those nations. Everything you need to create your own unique squad of soldiers!

At the start of each mission, you each select one or more Player Soldiers, equip them with skills, weapons, and combat gear within the mission's Resource limit. You then fight your way through hostile territory and engage enemy soldiers, as you attempt to reach and complete your mission objective. Every mission is a stand-alone game. You build your Soldiers, select your Gear, and then run your mission. Within 30 to 60 minutes you will have succeeded or failed.

The contents of this set includes 280 cards comprising:


    9 Italian Player Soldiers / 3 Team Soldiers / 5 Non-Player Soldiers / 5 Squad Soldiers
    8 Missions / 8 Objectives / 18 Locations
    15 Weapons / 11 Gear / 1 Unarmed Combat
    25 Skills
    10 Situation / 4 Service Records
    78 Action / 12 Location Markers
    60 UK Hostiles / 8 Events
    6 counter sheets with 516 counters
    d6 and d10 dice
    Mounted display board
    Warfighter Universal Rulebook


As with all Warfighter products, Warfighter: Mediterranean is compatible with all other Warfighter products, especially the Europe, Pacific and North Africa WWII core boxes.

—description from the publisher

Keep an eye out for the quantity, color, and type of candy. As soon as you see a common feature on 3 cards put them in your victory pile! Very fast, very simple, very fun. 
There are 5 colours, 4 types of sweets and 3 options of quantity on the cards. 
Cards are being laid out slowly. 
All players watch the opened cards and act simultaneously.
As soon as there are 3 cards with a common feature on the table players have to identify the feature and say it out loud. E.g. "Ice cream!" or "Blue!" or "Two!" 
Whoever calls out the feature first takes the cards.
The goal is to collect the most cards.
Where are some wild cards which can block a category or substitute any feature in category.

5 cool things about Lollipops

     everyone loves sweets
     fast-paced and noisy gameplay – perfect icebreaker
     keeping in mind 3 features instantly pumps up the reaction, speed, and attentiveness
     just a little space needed to play
     easy to carry around.


—description from the publisher

ãƒŠãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¹ã‚¤ãƒƒãƒ (Number Switch) is a game from Japan, based upon a local news story. An electronics store was giving away a free Nintendo Switch, but didn't use a sensible method of picking the winning number. As a result, two customers had the numbers either side of the winning number. The game designer used this event as the inspiration for this deduction game.

The game uses a suit of 1-13 cards from a normal deck of playing cards. One player is the retailer, the other players are the customers in the lottery. The retailer shuffles the 13 cards and removes one in secret, which nobody sees.

Then the retailer divides the 12 remaining cards into two piles and sorts them each from low to high numbers, placing them face-down. The players take turns to draw the top card from a pile and after getting three hand cards, a player make declare the hidden card. If they are correct, they win.

If the cards run out and no player has guessed correctly, the retailer can declare a number card that a player has (deducing in reverse). If the player does hold that card in their hand, the retailer wins.

As with other games from Loserdogs, this was produced in a simple ziplock baggie with only a page of rules and 13 playing cards.
user summary

Find a robot with the right combination of shapes or colors. Repeat the move and collect the winning card. 
Do the robot dance!

There are 20 cards with robots. Each has a unique combination of colors, shapes, and a unique movement. Small cards indicate colors and shapes.
To enjoy the game call your children and their friends, put 20 robot cards in a circle, small cards are in the center. Each round you open a small card. All players are looking for a robot with such colors or shapes. The first person to repeat the move receives the small card as a victory point. The goal is to collect the most cards.
5 cool things about ROBODANCE

     active and dynamic game
     combines developing fast response and attention with movement. 
     the moves such as dab, rock, and peace sign are trendy and kids like to repeat them.
     the complexity can be easily adjusted 
     all players are included in the process throughout the game.


—description from the publisher

This is a freebie game by Toryo Hojo where players are the head of local Japanese government and try to reduce the number of people affected by the decline of the economy from COVID-19.
Players muct make good use of the “Manbo” policy to slow down the new Coronavirus!

Each player controls regions of Japan that have a matrix of infected population and economic health. On their turn, a player rolls dice and performs an action from the chart:


     COVID excise tax increase
     Healthcare subsidy
     Unemployment stimulus
     Stay-at-home request
     Go eat
     Go travel
     "Manbo!"


With the other die, they must raise the infected population of the matching region.

Because the COVID outbreak occurred in the same year the Tokyo Olympics were scheduled to happen, the torch relay happens contemporaneously with player actions and is used as a timer for the end of the game.

The game was included as a part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

'"For sheer fun, it's one hard act to follow . . ."

Act One is the exciting game where players do "almost anything" to try and get their teammates to guess titles of popular movies and TV shows. You'll laugh your head off (until it's your turn) watching your teammates do their best to act or read famous lines from movies and TV shows while they try to beat the clock (actually it's a sand-timer). The sooner teams guess titles correctly, the more points are scored! (But, who cares who wins, when it's this much fun).

No batteries necessary . . . Teammates not included.

Almost two thousand movie and TV moments from the 70's, 80's and 90's. Great party game.

Games Magazine Top Games Selection

Now includes: 25% more cards & the new "Almost Anything Goes" round!'

—description from the back of the box

In Forts & Forests: The War for North America, you command one of the 18th century’s great superpowers in a struggle to control Canada, the American colonies and the vast wealth of the continent beyond.

But the French & Indian War is only part of a greater global conflict, so resources are limited and must be allocated with care. Militia is easily raised but unreliable. Regular forces deliver power and strength under fire, but they are expensive and must be transported across an ocean. Then there are gifts to the Indians, whose speed and fierce ambushes can turn the tide of the war, but only if their pricey allegiance can be maintained.

Forts & Forests begins with the British poised to launch an ambitious four-pronged attack to bring the war to a speedy end. They have greater numbers, naval superiority and secure ports, but much of their army is made up of untested colonial provincial forces. The push inland from the Atlantic coast will be difficult, and the support of the powerful Iroquois is tepid at best.

Though outnumbered, most French troops are battle hardened regulars recently arrived from Europe. They are supported by fearsome hordes of western tribes who have been convinced to take up the hatchet against the English invaders. New France also has a geographic advantage; troops and supplies can be moved quickly along the St. Lawrence and Great Lakes with relative ease. But the connection to France is tenuous, especially if the bastion at Louisbourg were to fall!

Forts & Forests’ unique combat system captures the challenges and uncertainties of the wilderness war. Over 300 historically accurate unit cards capture their differing combat, ambush, break, and speed ratings. No battle is a sure victory regardless of numerical superiority!

It will take strategy, determination, and a bit of luck to conquer a land of Forts & Forests and win the War for North America.

—description from the publisher

Linkto Terre is a co-operative trivia game in which players team up to find the key amongst the 50 cards that feature unique earth art.

Together, players link all 49 clue cards to the 50 word cards. They then discover whether the remaining, unlinked word card is the key to their victory, validating its code with the answer card to know whether they've won the game!

Linkto Terre offers five levels of difficulty in the game as well as a competitive mode for those who want it.

Monster Clashhh! is a fast and fun ROLL & FIGHT game. You have to be first friends with all 5 monsters! When you be a friends with monsters, attack another player! Also you have to keeping the most life points at the same time. Risk management, tactical choices and luck are the keys which will lead you to the victory.

Gameplay

1. Every player receives one summoner’s sheet.
2. Players play clockwise.
3. First player rolls the four dice, trying to get a combo allowing you to fill the spaces of Monster or the spaces of Special Ability. You can roll 3 times the dices (choosing the one(s) you wanna roll again).
4. When you decide to stop (usually after the 3rd roll), trigger the effect of your final combos according to the rules.
5. When you finish, the player at your left can play his turn (by rolling his dice and completing his summoner’s sheet).
6. The game is over when a player succeeds in summoning the five different monsters while having the most HP or if all of his opponents lose all of their HP.

—description from the publisher

Pick Pic is a game about picture associations and crazy funny photos.
You have to divide your photos so they fit the photos in front of each player as well as possible. If the other players recognize your photo as being placed there deliberately, both will score points. But they prefer a random photo to yours, none of you will get any points.

Gameplay

1. Reveal a card : every player draws a card and puts it face up in front of him.
2. Give cards : each player draws a few cards (regarding the number of players) and watches them secretly.
3. Each player has to look carefully at the face up cards of the other players, they must find a common feature between the cards they hold and the one which are in front of the players.
4. Once they finish finding a common feature, they have to give, face down, one card from their hand to every other player.
5. Rank cards : When all players have received exactly one card from each of the other players, they have to draw one random card from the deck and shuffle it into their stack of cards without revealing it.
6. Each player may look at the cards in front of him. They have to rank them face up, placing the card which has most in common with the first picture in first position, and so on.
7. Evaluate score : The players will score points regarding which rank are their cards.
8. End : The game ends when one or few players reach 20 points, if they don’t, they begin another round.

—description from the publisher

Bezzerwizzer Timeline combines the two games Bezzerwizzer and Timeline.

Each player/team gets 4 cards with a historical events, and has to place them at the correct place on the timeline - but if you're wrong, the other teams can get point by playing the Bezzerwizzer token!

By using the Zwap token, you can exchange two of the cards in play, so you get one of the opponent's cards and they get one of yours, or you can just swap between two opponents.

The longer you wait to place your cards, the more points they  will yield - but it will also be more difficult, as there are more cards on the timeline.

ãƒãƒˆãƒ«ã‚¢ã‚¹ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒˆ (Battle Athlete) is a racing game from Japan. Players are athletes competing in a road race across mountains and valleys. But the course has obstacles and the players push each other around or use items to get the jump on the others. The first to the finish line is the winner.

The race course is made of large tiles placed in a line. The game has a starting tile, and five course tiles, of which four are used, and a finish line. The course tiles have a variety of icons; walls, pits, arrows and objects.

Players choose the turn order, and the last player puts their athlete where they like on the start line, then the next player and so on. In this way, the start player does not get an advantage.

Players roll dice and move their athlete. If they end up on an icon, or push another athlete onto one, the actions are completed.

Pits make a player fall back 2 places and miss a turn. Walls delay players, and arrows push them in the direction of the arrow. The ? icon lets the player draw an object card from the deck. These objects allow the player to make advances, or delay other players, or even change the position of the course tiles.

The first player to reach the finish line wins the race.

The designer Misaki notes that this was one of their earliest designs. It became the third game published by the doujin circle, but had been a car race game sent to a magazine five years previously. The prototype was made 15 years before 2009, making it 1994. The designer thought it was too good a game to waste and brought it back into production in 2009.
user summary

For centuries, the Novarchs, descendants of the royal House of Novarchon, have ruled with an iron fist over the feudalistic galactic empire of humankind, the Domineum. During this time, they brought stunning technological innovation and scientific advancements to their domain. This accelerated progression helped the Domineum reach — and eventually inhabit — even the farthest segments of the known galaxy, where new Houses emerged to govern the outer sectors of the empire. As the House of Novarchon grew in power, so grew the religious cult that surrounded them, proclaiming grim prophecies about an ancient cosmic being from another dimension: the Voidborn.

Many thought it to be only a myth, but in truth, it was the Voidborn's dark influence that granted the Novarchs the sheer knowledge to achieve rapid expansion for the empire. While the cult of the Novarchs envisaged eternal life through the otherworldly entity, the Voidborn's only intention was satiating its eternal hunger. And so, when the Domineum had achieved a vastness fitting the Voidborn's craving, interdimensional rifts opened at the heart of the Domineum to unleash cosmic corruption. As the House of Novarchon and its followers welcomed the Voidborn and sought their false salvation, the entity infected and spread and seized control over the inner worlds. Now, it is time for the remaining Great Houses to purge the galactic corruption, prevent the Voidborn from fully manifesting in our dimension, and to ultimately overcome the chaos as the new rulers of the Domineum.

Voidfall is a space 4X game that brings the genre to Euro enthusiasts' tables. It combines the tension, player interaction, and deep empire customization of the 4X genre with the resource management, tight decisions, and minimum-luck gameplay of an economic Euro. Win by pushing back the Voidborn in the solo/coop mode, or by overcoming your rivals' influence in restoring the Domineum in the competitive mode — both using the same rule set and game system. Variability is ensured not only by multiple playable houses with their own strengths and weaknesses, but also by many different map set-ups for all game modes.

As the leader of a defiant Great House, you play through three cycles, each with a game-altering galactic event, a new scoring condition, and a set number of focus cards that can be played. Focus card decisions and sequencing is the centerpiece of the gameplay. By selecting two of their three impactful actions as you play them, you develop and improve techs; advance on your three house-specific civilization tracks; manage your sectors' infrastructure, population, and production; and conquer new sectors with up to five different types of space fleets. Space battles are fought either against the Voidborn's infected forces (which are present as neutral opponents even in the competitive mode) or against other players. Instead of relying on the luck of a die roll, battles in Voidfall are fully deterministic and reward careful preparation and outsmarting your opponents.

—description from the publisher

A chameleon’s life isn’t easy–constantly adapting to new environments and hiding from predators like snakes! It takes a lot of patience to sneak around and hunt bugs for food. No one truly appreciates the chameleon’s plight!

You are a chameleon just trying to make your way in this world, eating one bug at a time. Eat specific colors of bugs in the right order to win. Snatch tasty insects right out from under your opponents as you navigate the board fraught with dangerous snakes and other competitive chameleons.

Players take turns moving around the board to collect bugs of their same color. Throughout the game players roll to add more bugs to the board. As chameleons, players can change their own color in order to eat new bugs and pass safely by snakes of the same hue. The game includes 21 colored chameleon meeples for this very purpose.

As players start and complete objective cards they collect achievement cards which can help with additional actions or alternative ways to score. Whenever an objective is completed, the active player rolls a die and moves a progress marker along the game track. When the marker reaches the end, the game is over and all players tally their scores.

—description from the designer

Arithmetic game with a traditional card deck, from David Parlett, creator of Ninety-Nine.  From a hand of 5, players play a card at a time, either deducting from or dividing into the current sum. Totals start at 101 each hand and go down to as close to 0 as possible. The catch is: If card played divides into the sum without remainder then it may not be deducted but must divide. (For instance a 5 played to 20 must divide for 4 rather than deduct for 15, whereas a 3 must deduct since it can't divide into 20 evenly.)

An Ace counts either 1 or 11. A Jack played repeats the same value as the previous card. A Queen reverses the digits of the current count. However, you may only play a Queen if reversing the digits reduces the count. A King divides by any desired number higher than 1 and lower than the current, provided that it leaves no remainder.

The hand ends when one player plays their last card or is unable to play without going below zero.

This game puts you behind the wheel of one of the most important tech companies in the last century. You will relive the stories of some of the most influential technology innovators in history that paved the way to what we are capable of today. People like Edwin H. Land, a scientist who invented a whole new paradigm in photography with Polaroid, or Nolan Bushnell who executed on the first ever video gaming ideas with Atari, that drove the world into an age of digital video games and personal computers. It will be like being inside an interactive documentary, where you play the founder first person.

You start as a simple tech start-up and through multiple plays you and the story evolve into giving you the responsibility of turning your first product successes into a real tech company that people worship. A company that aims to take over the world with cutting edge inventions by visionary and quirky personalities.

You will attract the best talent, develop prototypes and turn them into mind boggling customer experiences. You will need to compose a sweet spot of skills in product design and engineering, business, management, marketing, and people. Talent with certain know-how can help you create better quality products. But to make all that happen you need investors and business-savvy individuals who can open the doors you need to succeed in a competitive consumer space of other tech companies - your opponents who you meet over beers at conferences and in courtroom disputes over patent infringement.

Through a new and profound way of pairing a board game with an app on your phone, the initial barrier of getting past a complex set of rules is replaced by a progressive approach that teaches you the game through a simple first start-up story. Then it grows more and more complex over the course of multiple play sessions towards transforming you into becoming a massive tech giant in the end.

The app will also be used to communicate the narrative through audio storytelling, to communicate every mechanic’s tie-in to the theme and context, to manage gaming sessions in this new narrative format, where you can save your progress between play sessions, and to be a rules learning or reminder companion, to get you quickly back into the game, if you have had a break from it.

—description from the designer

Word Colony combines the pursuit of trivia with the challenge of a word game thanks to more than 440 trivia questions with multiple choice answers. Each question appears on a card that also displays a letter and its value when scored.

On your turn, select a card from your hand and read the question, plus the possible answers, to the table. All other players secretly vote on which answer they believe to be correct, and each player who identifies the correct answer draws a number of cards equal to that card's value. If no one chooses the correct answer, instead you cards equal to that card's value.

Finally, you can score points by spelling words onto the table in front of you with the letter cards in hand. If you have enough cards, you may spell multiple words and score multiple times on you turn; when you spell multiple words, you use the last letter of a previously spelled word as the first letter of the new word. If anyone has only a single word in front of them — instead of a colony of at least two words — another player can steal that word (and its points) by colonizing it with a second word.

Play to a pre-determined point total.

There's always something going on at the farm: cows, horses, pigs, rabbits and chickens run around happily and the tractor chugs across the yard. There is a lot to discover and name, which expands vocabulary and trains perception. The cute figures invite free play and the first rule game. Who finds the right place for his animal?

The players move by dice over a circuit to collect cards with Swiss costumes cards. The goal is to get sets of 4 cards from as many neighboring cantons as possible to get many extra points. Event cards and fields that lead to card loss are also present. The game ends when all costume cards have been distributed. The player with the most valuable sets wins.

Billions of years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. This in turn reduced the planet’s ability to maintain heat. After centuries of research, Mars’ leading scientists have developed a way to slow the depletion of oxygen and the cooling of the planet; however, it’s too little and far too late. It’s only a matter of time before the planet becomes completely uninhabitable. In this harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars dangle from their last thread of existence.

Overview
Each player will represent a leader of one of the remaining races of ancient Mars. They will struggle to maintain the morale of their populace, while helping to keep the planet survivable for as long as possible. Players will also need to maintain control of lands to provide food, water and other resources—a task which may require force. Players will take turns placing multi-use cards on action spaces. The action space chosen will determine which part of the player’s card is activated (political, civil, or military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence to gain more powerful actions, develop technologies to help combat the planet’s condition, gather resources to help keep their populace happy, and train armies to maintain their lands and resources. Each race is equipped with a unique ability allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer

A special forces recon unit was a on secret mission when their helicopter crashed in the middle of the Vietnam jungle. The unit survived but not the pilot. With the mission scrubbed you have to make to back to the extraction zone and back to safety before the enemy tracks you down and captures you.

Your unit is trying to get to the extraction zone and they are being tracked by the enemy. Each turn your unit and the enemy randomly draw a number of colored d6 in specific order and place them on the player and enemy cards. Depending on the color of the die drawn, will determine any extra bonuses you or the enemy receive. Your squad must defeat the enemies dice to move to the next jungle terrain card. Each move you make can add or delete to your supplies "dice". It is a race to see who can get to the extraction zone first. If the enemy reaches the EZ first, your unit is captured. If the unit reaches the EZ first, you win. Your unit has special abilities that can be used one per game so be careful when using them.

-description from designer

In a mansion at the edge of town, a security alarm is blaring. As the rookie police officer, you've been assigned to investigate. Inside the mansion, you discover the body of a murdered woman and another shocking fact: the front door—and all other doors—cannot be opened from the inside. You are locked inside this obscure mansion with a corpse and no door handles... Your only way out is to escape. In this Escape Room-meets-jigsaw puzzle board game, you must solve the riddles in order to earn new puzzle pieces and unlock new rooms. It's your only way to exit the game and survive.

In this Escape Room-meets-jigsaw puzzle board game, you must solve the riddles in order to earn new puzzle pieces and unlock new rooms. It's your only way to exit the game and survive.

Thanks to the packaging's clever advent calendar design, you solve one large puzzle—the mansion—by completing 5 separate puzzles (the rooms). Read the story and solve the riddles in order to earn your puzzle pieces—and your eventual escape!

Play with or without time pressure. Feel like being put to the ultimate test? Set a time limit for your escape. If you prefer to pace yourself, forgo the clock and take your time to discuss the mystery and solve the puzzle.

Housed in an advent calendar-like design, the box includes all components for game play: riddles, puzzle pieces (1 large house which is made up of 5 smaller puzzles) & a puzzle-style decoder to check your answers.

Quadragon is a card-driven strategy game in which players build an army of dragons and dragon-riding wizards in order to steal their opponent's treasure and protect their own.

Each card in Quadragon uses both sides of the card, and both sides are split in two, meaning that each card can be used in 4 different ways. One side contains a dragon and treasure, the other a wizard and spell. Dragons are used to attack your opponent's treasure and defend your own. Treasure is used to pay for wizards. Wizards can also steal treasure directly, or ride similarly-colored dragons for even more points. Spells can be cast by wizards to directly manipulate the battlefield, for example rotating or flipping cards, or scoring points. Each side of a card can only be used if the text is facing you, and all cards rotate after use. For example after attacking with a dragon it rotates to reveal its treasure, which makes it vulnerable to attack.

It is always a thrill to chain together a sequence of spells to flip and rotate cards, culminating in a massive points-scoring attack. The first player to reach 50 points wins.

-description from designer

A dice game with shapes instead of numbers. You must collect each shape, but only once, if you roll a shape you have alreay collected, all the dice left, add together for points. As soon as a player reaches 15 points, the player with the lowest score wins.

Your peaceful day at the national history museum is shattered in an instant. Something feels off, a strange tension in the air. Just as you're beginning to piece together what's wrong, a tap on your shoulder jolts you. A shadowy figure leans in close and whispers, “We’ve been watching you. We need your help. A priceless American treasure is in danger, and a ruthless gang is closing in fast. Will you join us?” Your heart races as fear and excitement collide. The clock is ticking, and only you can unravel the secrets hidden within the nation's landmarks before it’s too late. Will you rise to the challenge?

The Independence Incident, title #2 in the Holiday Hijinks line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required.

When you have solved a puzzle on the cards, you will enter the answer into the companion website (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the website will tell you which card or cards to take next. The website also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

This system is non-destructible: some groups may choose to write on cards, but this is not required. A group cannot re-play the game, but can pass it on to another group for their use.

This entry in the series takes about an hour to solve, and is rated 3 out of 3 in difficulty.

A solo soccer storytelling game.

Experience the last minutes of the last match of a grueling soccer campaign, the glory or the heartbreak of an all-or-nothing result.  Ten minutes plus stoppage time remain.  All still to play for.

It is the 80th minute . . .

To play you will need:

     10 to 20 minutes
     two 6-sided dice
     a standard 52 card deck
     a 20-sided die (or pen and paper)
     some way to narrate the events as they unfold on the pitch


Flip a card representing a minute of time and roll to see if your team has the grit to weather the late pressure, if the referee is going to add more time.

Narrate the play on the field (for a radio, blog, or newspaper audience) based on prompts tied to each card.

If the last card is discarded before a goal is conceded, your team wins the title (or avoids relegation, or qualifies for the World Cup)!

—description from the designer

A game designed for those that wish to leave 2020 behind! Create your circle of friends to help you survive the financial hardships of 2020. Do whatever it takes to survive this year above the rest but remember: Problematic players lose their jobs, sponsorships, friends and sometimes even money.

In 2020: The Board Game, players will use their turns to acquire friends, earn income, and avoid the harrowing pitfalls of the real-life disaster that was the year 2020. On each turn, the player will roll the dice, and move their piece the corresponding number of spaces. They then draw and resolve a Social Media card that will present them with a unique real world event that happened in 2020. After drawing the card, players then must resolve the space they've landed on, which may mean acquiring a new friend to help you through the game, or gaining money and/or paying off debt they've accrued.

Players gain survival points based on the cards that they play, and when a player has acquired ten survival points, the end of the game is triggered. At the end of that round, players count their money and the player with the most money wins.

2020: The Board Game provides players with a chance to look back and laugh at the monstrosity of 2020.

—description from the designer

Familiy Frakass is a Beat them up board game.
It’s a 1 to 3 players cooperative boardgame based on the main characteristic than Beat them up game: Hit, Strike, Weapons, Combo, Henchmen, Boss...
The objective is quite simple, clean the board of each scene of the stage to reach the Boss. Beat it and continue on the next stage.

Each player will have a character with their own  specificities.
Then the game will switch between 2 phases: The Player turn and the Game turn.
During the Player turn, the player will use up to 3 action points to make his character moves, strikes or one of the 10 actions available for him.
The only main rules to follow there is: “A player cannot do the same action twice in the row during his turn.” (Means, you can Move, Strike and Move, but you cannot Move, Move, and Strike.)
Then when players finish their turn, the Game turn will start and the game will move by itself following 5 main actions. Those actions are also link to the action
Then it will be to the player turn again.

Regarding the Strike part, player will use colors cards common to all players. Each Heroes character have his own combos. A combo is a specific combination of colors. Means you will have to choose between use your cards of save it to prepare the combo.
You can now add Weapons, Group combo, Character posture and lots of mechanism for more fun and strike! (^_^)

If I try to explains this game by “mechanism”, I would say that an Action evolutive Puzzle, because the situation will change at every Game turn depending of the action done by player(s).

—description from the designer

Winter War 1939: A Solo Game

A solo game where you command a platoon of Finnish infantry trying to stop waves of Russian attackers.
The Russians will still keep on coming until they eventually win.
The object of the game is to see how many waves of attackers you stop.

A simple to play game with lots of variety to keep the game different each time you play.

Turn Sequence:
1- Activate Russian troops
2- Activate Finnish troops
3- Roll for random events

—description from the publisher

This cooperative game continues the classic adventure from Disney’s Mickey and the Beanstalk. Join Mickey, Minnie, Donald, and Goofy, as you work together to collect food from the Giant’s table. Don’t get caught or the Giant will lock the food away! Rescue the Golden Harp from the lock box and slide down the vine to bring everything home. Feed the village and return the harp to Happy Valley to win!

Join your favorite friends from Disney’s Alice in Wonderland in this topsy-turvy teacup-stacking game! Play a card to place a teacup, but don’t let the tilting tower fall! Each card tells you which teacup to stack, or adds a fun twist to the tea party. The Mad Hatter may give you a tip, or he may tip the table. Maybe the Cheshire Cat will help you stay on top. Look out for the White Rabbit! Be the first to play all your cards to win. See how tall the tea party gets in this wild Wonderland game!

The out-of-your-seat game with two ways to find Mickey! Play hide and seek with the colorful Mickey Markers, plus look for Hidden Mickeys on the cards! Two clever activities in one fun-filled game! On your turn, flip over a card from the pile. If you flip a Mickey card, one player hurries to find the matching

Hidden Mickey Marker in the house or yard! Bring it back in time to score a card! Once all the Mickey Markers have been found, search for Hidden Mickeys on your reward cards! Find the most Mickeys to win!

It's the end of the Roman Empire: barbarians at the gates, rebels inside the empire, fighting in the senate.
Will you be able to avoid fate, or will Rome be destroyed?

Delenda Roma is a single player board game when you try to stop the inevitability of the history.

At the start of the game player get a limited amount of gold and armies to be placed on roman provinces, then gameplay is divided in phases:


     Event phase: from a deck of cards a new challenge is revealed ( like for example new barbarian invading from outside of the empire or a rebellion on the roman provinces).
     Battle phase: for provinces with enemy armies a deterministic fight occurs
     Upkeep phase: determine for provinces who is in control and apply consequences
     Enemy phase: every enemy units move according to their type
     Player phase: player can spend gold to move armies (by land and sea), recruit new armies, placate rebels or bribe the senate
     Senate phase: from another deck of cards a senate card is revealed and player has limited turns to fulfil the mission


Player lose when barbarian or rebels take control of Roma and win if they can survive at least 20 turns.

—description from the designer

The players, as the police, try to catch the main train robber, which is secretly determined by the robber-players and find the bag of loot by moving policemen around the game map and collecting hints. Movement is determined by a die.

The players form two teams: the police and the robbers. Any player may move any figure of hie own team. The robber team decides in secret which robber is the main culprit and which bag contains the loot. From this information they create a secret password from the main feature of the main culprit and the letter of the bag with the loot, for example Moon Boot (Monocle + B 001). The card with the number of the loot bag is removed from the stack and the stach is placed front down on it's space on the game board. The robbers and the bags (front down) are placed on the railway bridge and the police officers at police headquarters.

The robbers try to reach a hideaway (circular blue spaces), which can't be entered by a policeman. If a robber reaches a hideaway the player takes a bag from the bridge and places it inside the hideaway. The police have half an hour to find the main culprit and the bag with the loot. They try to reach the railway bridge while there are still some robbers and bags.

If a policeman gets to the railway bridge, he may turn over all the bags still there and takes all robbers still at at bridge to the prison to interrogate them.

If a figure gets on an orange space, the player takes the upper card from the stack and follows the instructions printed there, depending if he is a policeman or a robber. Some cards contain information for the police about empty bags.

The policemen take robbers into prison to interrogate them, if they land on a space occupied by a robber. During the first interrogation the robber has to tell the password. In further interrogations the police asks about the features of the main culprit (main feature, clothes, tie, ...). The robber has to answer truthfully wit "yes" or "no". Additionally the policeman may turn over any bag and ask, if this bag contains the loot.

The police wins, if they discover who is the main culprit and which bag contains the money inside half an hour. If not, the robbers win. The robbers win also if all get into hideaways, where they are safe from the police.

Number Drop is a Tetris-style roll-and-write game played with shapes and numbers.

Players use 4 number dice and 1 shape die to determine the way they must fill in their grid, by creating the shape with the numbers. Players also have 5 block tiles they can use to block the other players' grid.

In this game, you must drop shapes in the right places to create combinations of identical or consecutive numbers on your grid. You aim at being the most efficient and being able drop penalties onto your opponents !
As soon as a player reaches the Game Over line, the game ends and whoever has the most points is the winner.

Will you reach the ultimate score of 100 ?

The game is played on a stylized map of Europe with a printed transport network. Players are given a starting location, a destination, and 4 transportation orders to 4 European cities. Players set a driving route and move their pieces across the transportation network. The movement is controlled by a turntable. Depending on the freight, one of the 8 possible directions and speeds of travel can be selected 4 times truck (slow), 2 times freight train (medium) or 2 times freight express train (fast). 
In his turn, the player rolls the dice once and must either draw and execute an event card or turn the turntable to the left or right and move his figure accordingly. Cities with transport orders and the destination city must be reached exactly.
The player who arrives first at his destination city wins the game.

—user summary

Enchanters is all about saving a village from monsters. Shuffle a few Kingdom decks together to create the set of items, enchantments and threats! On your turn, journey to collect a card from these decks, or rest to recover. Stack up equipment and enchantments to become the best battlemage!

In the fantasy card-drafting game Enchanters, you create an artifact and upgrade it each turn. Every card you take retains some of its power. As you grow stronger, you can take on more powerful monsters and, if you plan well, even defeat a dragon.

To set up the game, each player takes five crystals, then you shuffle together as many kingdom decks as the number of players, then lay out six cards (either items of enchantments) on the journey track. In the game, players take turns to embark on quests, collecting cards from the journey track by paying with crystals. Acquired cards are placed into adjacent stacks, with something like “Long Sword” going into the item stack and cards like “of Fire” going into the enchantment stack; combined, these cards create the “Long Sword of Fire”, and cards grant both temporary bonuses (upper icons and skills) and permanent ones (bottom icons).

Included in the Deluxe Box :

Overlords decks: Bandits, Cultists, Unicorns, Gnolls, Goblins, Draco, Barbarians, Faires, Angels, Troglodytes , Undead, Dark Elves, Golems, Mages, Slimes and Demons

Odyssey decks: Centaurs, Gladiators, Harpies, Medusae, Mermaids and Mummies

East Quest: decks Ninjas, Monks, Samurais, Nagas, Pirates and Geishas

Event Deck
    Class Deck
    Banner Deck
    Coop Deck
    Mythic Deck
    Wound Deck (eshop exclusive)
    Quest Deck
    all Villages
    all Overlords
    Banners and classes
    Crystal set
    Plastic Wound tokens
    Shuriken Tokens
    Pearl Tokens
    Defence and attack plastic tracker tokens
    Fate cards for Solo play
    Neoprene kit

PickUp is a fast-paced basketball deck-building card game that will wow you with it's authentic basketball gameplay and 40+ visually stunning characters!

The game puts you in the roles of GM, coach, and player, interweaving chance and strategy.

In an exciting head-to-head showdown, each team starts with the same roster of players. Teams can then use their players on the court or trade them for better, more specialized players to build out their roster.

—description from the publisher

The largest club in the country celebrates its 130th anniversary and can be discovered shortly via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every centimetre, exciting matches that go back and forth, the insane goal that falls from the sky or the repulsive comeback: experience the most beautiful moments of Club Brugge with family and friends!

Club Brugge is and remains the biggest football club in the country. This has not changed in recent years, quite the contrary. 
Dribble through Club icons from past and present. 
Discover the best Club players, create your own ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Club Brugge is the ideal way to relive the blue-black's finest moments.

Bluvn Goan - We Are Bruges

The Limited Fan Edition has a stylish hand numbered sleeve. Only 1891 pieces of this edition are available.

–description from the publisher

In this game, each player assumes the role of an artist in the disputed world of galleries. Each player has one special skill from the character and must use them wisely throughout the game.

Each turn, one of the players will be the Maecenas and make a request. Each artist must choose one card in hand that best fits the Maecenas demand, the closer you get to it, the more points you get.

For the production of Art Gallery, the game designer Igor Colares invited dozens of people, among them children, adults, professional illustrators and amateurs. For each one, Igor asked for an art and said a feeling and an element. The artists then created based on that request. What we have as a result is an incredible variation of styles and a fun walk through the subjectivity of each person.

—description from the designer

Discover the most famous national football team in the world now via this exclusive Monopoly edition!

The battle for every inch, captivating matches, the last minute goal for which everyone is holding their breath: experience the most exciting Red Devils moments with your family and friends!

This generation of Devils is the strongest our country has known. Both of them have experience in the best European competitions. Dribble through the national team and discover the best Belgian footballers. Lukaku, De Bruyne, Hazard, Witsel, Vertonghen, Courtois, ... put together your ideal team and beat the opposition!

Monopoly Belgian Red Devils is the perfect way to relive the best moments of this golden generation. See you at the final?

This game is bilingual NL-FR. With the English version we add maps and rules in English.

The limited edition gold comes with a hand-numbered gold leaf outer box and certificate. From this box, 1895 pieces are available.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hasselt has it: its own Monopoly!

Hasselt, provincial capital, trendsetter and ideal base for the province: Limburg begins here.

Historical sights are combined with art, culture, gastronomy and a vibrant atmosphere. 
Monopoly Hasselt is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way. 
Walk through the rich history and culture of the city, but make sure you don't end up in jail!

Visit the cathedral, build a hotel in the TT district, take a stroll in the Japanese Garden, go to the Jeneverfeesten or run a stall at Pukkelpop! Hasselt is a city on a human scale where past, present and future embrace one another.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beautiful things Hasselt has to offer. This unique edition is a must-have for every Hasseller, or Hasselt lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 100 hand numbered copies of this edition will be made. The box gets a unique, stylish sleeve and contains 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

–description from the publisher

The capital of Waasland is for sale! Sint-Niklaas, city of historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Sint-Niklaas is the ideal way to (re)discover Sint-Niklaas in a different way. 
Visit the Sint-Nicolas Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Witte Molen, organise a show in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in the Stationsstraat or take a stroll in the De Ster recreation area. 
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Sint-Niklaas has to offer.

This unique publication is a must-have for every Sint-Niklaas citizen or Sint-Niklaas-lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 91 copies of this edition will be made. The box will have a unique, stylish hand numbered sleeve.

–description from the publisher

A game where luck is cast aside in honour of memory, strategy and, after some time, skill. Set in the time of knights & wizards.

Battle your friends to earn the most tributes and buy your passage home.

Each player has 4 cards dealt to them, face down and takes it in turns to combat their foes around the table. You may look at your cards but cannot move the position of them. You select your cards to attack other players face down cards and then begin the process of endeavoring to remember where all the cards are, who to attack, what skills to play on opponents to mess with their gameplay etc.

Designed to remove the "Luck" element of card games and instead grant the winner victory via superior memory or strategic skills. With additional elements such as War Cry's and individual card skills, there's plenty to laugh about while playing.

–description from the designer

A memory game in which you don't have to find pairs of pictures but pairs of towers that sound the same. The towers are filled with material such as shells, pebbles, sand and much more.

The towers can also be filled with your own objects.

–user summary

Bag of Butts is a "push everybody's luck game".

When it is your turn, you announce how many butts you want to draw for which butt group before your first draw. Then you draw exactly three butt groups from the butt bag. Once you have drawn all the butts from the butt bag, you choose which one butt group you want to score. Not only you yourself though but everybody will get butt points for each of their butts in the butt group that you are scoring. The next player will then add a random special butt to the butt bag before they, too, draw all the butts. These change the game up a little but, more importantly, each player butt is also worth an additional butt point for each special butt that is in play.

Once you reach at least 28 butt points, the game ends with the next reset. A reset happens either because a player decides against adding another special butt to the bag or because there happens to be one or more special butts in each of the three butt groups that a player draws. Just because you are the first player who reaches 28 butt points does not necessarily mean that you will actually win the game.

—description from the publisher

Tofu God is a party game of story snippets.

You will use cards showing silhouettes, mostly of animals, in an attempt to fill out the proverbial blanks you are dealt in the form of questions. Meanwhile, everybody else will try to intuit your answers and, more importantly, also which silhouettes you have chosen to represent them.

When it is your turn, you will answer one of two randomly drawn conundrums. To do this you will have eight of your ten silhouettes to pick from. For each of the three questions that make up your conundrum you will secretly decide on the best and the worst answer from your point of view. Question by question, everyone else will try to guess your favorite answer. Whenever someone is correct, both you and that player will get a point. However, if a player mistakenly thinks that your least favorite answer might be your favorite one, that player loses one point. The game ends when everyone has had the same amount of turns. If you manage to earn the most points, you win.

—description from the publisher

In the game Guntia, you move your piece by rolling the dice on a map through the district of Günzburg to occupy free communities. You succeed in occupying a municipality if you win an extended Rock Paper Siccors (+2 more gestures) against your fellow players. Once a municipality is occupied, it may no longer be entered by other players, with the exception of the two municipalities in the centre. If a player has conquered 10 communities, or if a player cannot move for two rounds, the game is over. Points are awarded for occupied municipalities, as well as castles or coats of arms in the municipal area.

—user summary
